name: Something in Common Quiz: Colorful Songs | 25 Questions

questions.text: What colorful song does the line "I'm all alone in romance." come from?
questions.explanation:
A White Sports Coat.

	Marty Robbins sings "A White Sports Coat." Marty Robbins also raced cars in NASCAR.

questions.text: "When that elevator starts its ride" comes from what colorful song?
questions.explanation:
That Old Black Magic.

	Sammy Davis Jr. sings "That Old Black Magic." During his career Sammy Davis Jr. was known as "the world's greatest entertainer."

questions.text: What colorful song has the lyrics, "sugar is sweet my love, but not as sweet as you"?
questions.explanation:
Roses are Red My Love.

	Bobby Vinton sings this song. He was once invited to Poland by the Polish government.

questions.text: This colorful song is a popular Beatles tune, what is it: "So we sailed up to the sun, till we found a sea of green."
questions.explanation:
Yellow Submarine.

	On December 8, 1980 John Lennon was shot and killed by a fan named Mark Chapman. On November 29, 2001 George Harrison died of lung cancer. Both are greatly missed. Even today the Beatles are loved by all generations.

questions.text: What holiday song contains the line, "Just like the ones I used to know"?
questions.explanation:
White Christmas.

	"White Christmas" which was sung by Bing Crosby was written by Irving Berlin who was Jewish.

questions.text: Another Christmas song which is in "The Year Without a Santa Claus" and is also song by Elvis Presley contains this lyric "I'll be so blue thinking of you."
questions.explanation:
Blue Christmas.

	"The Year Without a Santa Claus" features the voice of Mickey Rooney as Santa and Shirley Booth as Mrs. Claus. It was released in 1974.

questions.text: Burl Ives sang this song in Rudolph as the Snowman: "How do we measure it's worth. Just by the pleasure it gives here on earth."
questions.explanation:
Silver and Gold.

	The snowman's name was Sam.

questions.text: This Prince song contains the following lyric "by the way u parked your car sideways."
questions.explanation:
Little Red Corvette.

	When Prince became "The Artist Formerly Known as Prince" he was a guest on "The Rosie O'Donnell Show" Rosie called him TAFKAP which he did not like.

questions.text: This colorful song is a Johnny Cash hit. "She's the fastest train on the line."
questions.explanation:
Orange Blossom Special.

	Johnny Cash was in the Air Force from 1950-1954.

questions.text: This colorful song is by Crystal Gayle. "Give me no reasons. Give me no alibis."
questions.correct: Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Blue
options: Don't It Make My Green Eyes Blue
Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Red
Don't It Make My Green Eyes Red
questions.explanation:
Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Blue.

	Crystal Gayle had really long hair.

questions.text: What is this colorful song, "We will miss your bright eyes."
questions.explanation:
Red River Valley.

	This cowboy song has been covered by many artists

questions.text: This holiday favorite is yet another colorful song. "It's Christmas time in the city."
questions.explanation:
Silver Bells.

	Mitch Miller, one of the many people who have a recording of this song, also  had a hit with another colorful song "Yellow Rose of Texas."

questions.text: This colorful song is one of my favorite Toby Keith songs. "My daddy served in the army where he lost his right eye."
questions.correct: Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue
options: I Love the Red, White and Blue
Thanks to the Red, White and Blue
questions.explanation:
Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue.

	Toby Keith has a daughter named Kyrstal.

questions.text: "All of the other reindeer used to laugh and call him names."
questions.explanation:
Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer.

	One of the biggest questions that has plagued people who have seen the cartoon is What is wrong with the dolly named Sue?

questions.text: This song was in the movie "Grease" in the prom scene. "You saw me standing alone"
questions.explanation:
Blue Moon.

	This song was written by Lorenz Hart. The music was done by Richard Rodgers.

questions.text: This old song is another colorful tune, "If I could erase those lines from your face."
options: My Bald Daddy who Use to Have Blond Hair
My Bald Daddy who Used to Have Red Hair
questions.explanation:
Silver Haired Daddy of Mine.

	On July 31 1964 Jim Reeves, who sang this song, was killed in a plane crash.

questions.text: Bobby Vinton has a hit with this colorful song. "Softer than satin was the light."
questions.explanation:
Blue Velvet.

	Bobby Vinton was born in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania on April 16, 1935.

questions.text: This colorful song is one of the greatest of all time in my opinion. "Silver wings upon my chest. These are men, America's best."
options: An Epic of the Green Berets
questions.explanation:
Ballad of the Green Berets.

	Sgt. Barry Sadler sings Ballad of the Green Berets. Sadler once served time for murder.

questions.text: This one is from "The Wizard of Oz." What colorful song tells us what to "Follow follow follow"?
questions.explanation:
The Yellow Brick Road.

	The "Wizard of Oz" once included the song "The Jitterbug" in which the Witch sends some bugs to dance with the four leads. The idea is they'll dance and dance till they can't dance anymore. This scene was in the play when my brother played the Scarecrow. In the movie the Witch makes reference when she says "I sent a little insect ahead."

questions.text: Van Morrison sang this colorful song, "Do you remember when we used to sing, Sha la la la la la la la la la la te da"
questions.explanation:
Brown Eyed Girl.

	Van Morrison was born in Belfast in 1945.

questions.text: This colorful song is in Act I of Les Misérables. "Do we fight for the right to a night at the opera now? Have you asked of yourselves what's the price you might pay?"
questions.explanation:
Red and Black.

	Jean ValJean's prison number was 24601.

questions.text: Elvis Presley is one of the people to sing this colorful tune. "Three to get ready now go cat go."
questions.explanation:
Blue Suede Shoes.

	Elvis Presley was born January 8, 1935. His middle name Aron is misspelled ("Aaron") on his tombstone. This is one of the reasons people say he is still alive.

questions.text: What is this colorful Elton John song, "I should have stayed on the farm"?
options: See Ya Later Yellow Brick Road
questions.explanation:
Goodbye Yellow Brick Road.

	Elton John has played the piano by ear since he was four years old.

questions.text: This jazz song is another colorful song "Two left feet,oh so neat!"
questions.explanation:
Sweet Georgia Brown.

	Ethel Waters, Ella Fitzgerald, and Louis Armstrong are some of the people who have recorded this song.

questions.text: Michael Jackson had a hit with this colorful song, "I took my baby on a Saturday bang."
questions.explanation:
Black or White.

	Michael Jackson is one of my favorite singers, despite his personal life being messed up. He is still one of the best performers ever. Michael Jackson played the Scarecrow in "The Wiz".
